result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on November 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:59 AM - 22CF255 & 22CF295 - Defendant Bryan Jay Pattison in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde in court for Bryan Jay Pattison.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court accepts waiver, binds over to Br 1; proceeds to arraignment. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't; cases to track together. Parties heard on Bond Motion. Stipulation to change to PA bond. Court heard; amends bond to $1500 PA bond; same conditions. 
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

w/22CF255: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:52 PM 22CF295 & 22CF255 (Initial on 9/19/22, call today): Defendant Bryan Jay Pattison appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde appeared by video for Bryan Jay Pattison (will appoint); Prosecuting attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $750 Cash bond; Atty. Van Kerkvoorde response; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 9/22/22 at 8:30am in Br. 3; Court sets $750.00 CASH Bond with conditions: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
